intro: Osmites pinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leaved osmite, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, pinnatifid leaves that give it a feathery appearance. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Africa and thrives in dry, sandy soils. Osmites pinnatifida is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
